title: FP91G
author: FP91G
content: Sam Bankman-Fried, the mop-haired, nerdy maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser, is facing the prospect of a lengthy prison sentence. On the eve of his trial for fraud and money laundering in New York, this programme reveals the breakneck rise and sensational fall of his $40 billion company, FTX, which he had boasted would take crypto into the mainstream but crashed, leaving more than a million customers with nothing. Through detailed research and interviews with his former associates, staffers and insiders, the film examines the numerous red flags that were overlooked, including how his scruffy image, celebrity hype and promises to give billions away to charity, blinded the world to alleged crimes that have plunged crypto into crisishttps://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/p0gffn3y/panorama-downfall-of-the-crypto-king-extended-version

comments.author: Jating
comments.body: I'm not really sure if BBC has covered things that we didn't know already. It must be good for newbies in investment though so they can see how this scammers really work behind. They can disguised like what SBF is, and then getting a lot of friends, sport personalities, Hollywood actors/actresses and how his background get himself to some major politicians to really bring himself to be the saviour and give supposedly billions to charities and make a lot of humanitarian works that his company or the money that he will get. But it all failed as everything crumbled last year causing billions upon billions of money lost from the downfall of SBF. I wouldn't watch it though to be honest, I'm not a victim but I don't want to see him being glorified in some kind of documentary.

comments.author: yazher
comments.body: I hope this is good and educational because we are in need of such documentaries where everything is there for the newbies to understand the concept of how to prevent themselves from falling into such same ordeal. Just as the other scam projects where the owners are friendly and always keep their community updated with what is going on with the projects whether in Telegram or Twitter. I think this documentary will help them realize not to easily get hyped whenever there is a new trend in the crypto industry in terms of new investment and they are going to make sure that whenever they decide to invest, they have already gone through lots of personal research.

comments.author: Alpha Marine
comments.body: Is he the biggest loser? Because with the right lawyers and influence, he might end up not going to jail or just getting a minimal sentence. Either way, the documentary is a good thing. That's if it's very detailed and touches every dirty secret that led us to things point. People need to realize that not all fraudulent people sit behind a screen and try to scam others for money, some put on suits and come in the form of people who want to change the world. I hope SBF gets what he deserves not just because of the harm people like him cause, but it should be as a lesson to others that you can't just fraud people of their money and walk away freely. Also, other financial company managers should know the risks involved before they make careless decisions.
